segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and we are your English language guides here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，我们是你们在EnglishPod的英语指导。

segments.en: That's right, and today we're going to be taking you to Christmas morning.
segments.cn: 没错，今天我们将带你们体验圣诞早晨。

segments.en: It's Christmas Day.
Oh, one of the best times of the year.
segments.cn: 哦，一年中最美好的时光之一。

segments.en: You wake up, you smell the good smell of delicious eggs and bacon, and there's presents.
segments.cn: 你醒来，闻到美味的鸡蛋和培根的香味，还有礼物。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess that's when you're a kid, though.
segments.cn: 是啊，我想那是你还是小孩的时候。

segments.en: I guess when you're an adult do you really get excited when you wake up for Christmas?
segments.cn: 我想当你长大后，圣诞节醒来真的会兴奋吗？

segments.en: Hell yeah.
Sure do.
Yeah, I sure do.
I love Christmas morning, even as an adult.
segments.cn: 我爱圣诞早晨，即使作为成年人。

segments.en: Especially, I think, because of the special breakfast you get, like pancakes, scrambled eggs.
segments.cn: 特别是，我认为，是因为你能享受到特别的早餐，比如煎饼、炒鸡蛋。

segments.en: But anyways, we're going to be taking a look at a situation here where a kid is opening Christmas presents and we're preparing a meal for Christmas because that day people are going to come over.
segments.cn: 不过无论如何，我们要看看一个小孩打开圣诞礼物的情景，同时我们在为圣诞准备一顿饭，因为那天人们会过来。

segments.en: So, let's listen to this dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们第一次听这个对话。

segments.en: Dad, dad, dad!
Wake up!
It's Christmas!
Timmy, it's too early for this.
Look, it's six in the morning.
Go back to bed.
No way!
Santa already came and left all our presents.
segments.cn: 圣诞老人已经来了，留下了我们的所有礼物。

segments.en: Can we go open them, please?
segments.cn: 我们可以去打开它们吗，拜托？

segments.en: Please?
Of course we can, honey.
Bill, come on, get dressed.
Fine, not like Santa brought me any gifts.
segments.cn: 好吧，反正圣诞老人也没给我带礼物。

segments.en: Bill, honestly, you can be such a grouch sometimes.
segments.cn: Bill，老实说，你有时候真是个脾气不好的人。

segments.en: Look at all these presents under the Christmas tree!
segments.cn: 看看圣诞树下的这些礼物！

segments.en: Awesome!
Alright, Timmy, knock yourself out.
We should get ready and head to the market to buy everything for Christmas dinner tonight.
segments.cn: 我们应该准备一下，去市场买今晚圣诞晚餐的一切。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
It's the first time we're hosting Christmas dinner at our house, so everything has to be perfect.
segments.cn: 这是我们第一次在家里举办圣诞晚餐，所以一切都必须完美。

segments.en: I got the list right here.
Ham, Turkey, mashed potatoes, ingredients for the gravy, and of course, yams.
segments.cn: 火腿、火鸡、土豆泥、肉汁的配料，当然还有红薯。

segments.en: My dad offered to bring the eggnog, so we should be set.
segments.cn: 我爸爸主动带来蛋奶酒，所以我们应该准备好了。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
So there were a couple of different and interesting words there, so let's take a look at them now in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以这里有几个不同且有趣的单词，让我们现在在语言学习中看看它们。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
Okay, this first word is not a very happy word.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个单词不是一个很快乐的词。

segments.en: It's a word that we try not to use too much around the Christmas season, but sometimes you're just tired of people because the holidays is all about people and doing stuff.
segments.cn: 这是一个我们在圣诞季节尽量不使用的词，但有时候你就是厌倦了人，因为假期就是关于人和做事情。

segments.en: Family.
Someone who is not being very happy, someone who's a little bit grumpy, is called a grouch.
segments.cn: 不太快乐的人，有点脾气不好的人，叫做脾气不好的人。

segments.en: Okay, so a person that's not very happy, not very friendly, is a grouch.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一个不太快乐、不太友好的人是脾气不好的人。

segments.en: I don't want to open presents.
This is stupid.
Okay, so a person is a grouch, or you can act like a grouch, or be a grouch.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一个人是脾气不好的人，或者你可以表现得像个脾气不好的人，或者成为一个脾气不好的人。

segments.en: Don't be a grouch!
Alright, and well, they were talking about heading to the market to buy something for dinner, so to head to.
segments.cn: 好吧，他们在谈论去市场买晚餐的东西，所以去。

segments.en: Okay, to head to is a way to say to go towards someplace, or to go somewhere.
segments.cn: 好的，去是说朝某个地方去，或者去某个地方。

segments.en: Alright, so if I'm driving my car and you ask me where I'm going, I'm saying, oh, I'm heading to to the bank.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果我开车，你问我去哪，我会说，哦，我去银行。

segments.en: Right, so to head to means to be on your way somewhere, I'm going somewhere.
segments.cn: 对，所以去意味着你在去某个地方，我正在去某个地方。

segments.en: It's a way to say that you're in the process of going.
segments.cn: 这是一种说你正在去的方式。

segments.en: You can't say, next year I will head to Alaska.
segments.cn: 你不能说，明年我将去阿拉斯加。

segments.en: Okay.
It doesn't make as much sense.
You usually say, you know, I'm heading to the bank, or let's head to the market.
segments.cn: 你通常会说，你知道，我正在去银行，或者我们去市场吧。

segments.en: Okay, and well, they were talking about heading to the market because they are hosting Christmas dinner, so to host.
segments.cn: 好的，他们在谈论去市场，因为他们要举办圣诞晚餐，所以举办。

segments.en: To host is a, well, it's a very important holiday term.
segments.cn: 举办是一个，非常重要的节日术语。

segments.en: It's a verb.
You do it, and it means that you are the person who has the special dinner, and your friends and family, they come to your house.
segments.cn: 你做这件事，意味着你是举办特别晚餐的人，你的朋友和家人会来你家。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay, so we could say, this Christmas, I'm hosting the dinner at my house.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说，这个圣诞节，我在我家举办晚餐。

segments.en: Okay.
So I want everyone to come to my house and eat.
segments.cn: 所以我希望每个人都来我家吃饭。

segments.en: Alright, and it can also be a noun, right?
segments.cn: 好的，它也可以是名词，对吧？

segments.en: You can say, I am a host.
segments.cn: 你可以说，我是一个主人。

segments.en: Exactly.
I'm the host of this dinner.
Right, and it doesn't have to be holidays either.
segments.cn: 对，而且这不一定是节日。

segments.en: You could say, hey, Marco, how about you host a dinner next week?
segments.cn: 你可以说，嘿，Marco，下周你来举办晚餐怎么样？

segments.en: I'll come.
Right, okay.
I'll bring wine.
Alright.
So, to host a dinner or to host a party, etc.
segments.cn: 所以，举办晚餐或举办派对，等等。

segments.en: And our fourth word for language takeaway is probably the most popular drink during the Christmas season, eggnog.
segments.cn: 我们的第四个语言学习单词可能是圣诞季节最受欢迎的饮料，蛋奶酒。

segments.en: Okay, it sounds kind of disgusting.
Yeah, a drink with egg.
But it's a very popular, creamy, eggy drink.
segments.cn: 但它是一种非常受欢迎的、奶油状的、蛋味的饮料。

segments.en: It's very thick, and it's cream colored.
segments.cn: 它非常浓稠，颜色是奶油色。

segments.en: And normally you add a little bit of rum.
segments.cn: 通常你会加一点朗姆酒。

segments.en: Okay, so it's alcoholic.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它是酒精饮料。

segments.en: And you drink it warm.
And it's kind of just a thick, warm alcoholic beverage that's very, very popular.
segments.cn: 它是一种非常浓稠、温暖的酒精饮料，非常受欢迎。

segments.en: And my dad loves it.
During Christmas, right?
During Christmas.
You don't have it like any other day.
segments.cn: 你不会在其他日子喝它。

segments.en: No, you wouldn't want to.
It's too heavy.
But it's very, very popular like the days before Christmas and on Christmas.
segments.cn: 但在圣诞节前几天和圣诞节期间非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Okay, so eggnog.
Very good.
So I think we should take a look at the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以我认为我们应该再看看这个对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back soon with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们很快会回来进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Dad, Dad, Dad, wake up.
It's Christmas.
Timmy, it's too early for this.
Look, it's six in the morning.
Go back to bed.
No way!
Santa already came and left all our presents.
segments.cn: 圣诞老人已经来了，留下了我们的所有礼物。

segments.en: Can we go open them, please?
segments.cn: 我们可以去打开它们吗？

segments.en: Please?
Of course we can, honey.
Bill, come on, get dressed.
Fine.
Not like Santa brought me any gifts.
segments.cn: 不是说圣诞老人给我带了什么礼物。

segments.en: Bill, honestly, you can be such a grouch sometimes.
segments.cn: 比尔，老实说，你有时候真是个脾气暴躁的人。

segments.en: Look at all these presents under the Christmas tree.
segments.cn: 看看圣诞树下的这些礼物。

segments.en: Awesome!
All right, Timmy, knock yourself out.
We should get ready and head to the market to buy everything for Christmas dinner tonight.
segments.cn: 我们应该准备一下，去市场买今晚圣诞晚餐所需的一切。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
It's the first time we're hosting Christmas dinner at our house.
segments.cn: 这是我们第一次在家里举办圣诞晚餐。

segments.en: So everything has to be perfect.
I got the list right here.
Ham, Turkey, mashed potatoes, ingredients for the gravy, and of course, yams.
segments.cn: 火腿，火鸡，土豆泥，肉汁的配料，当然还有红薯。

segments.en: My dad offered to bring the eggnog, so we should be set.
segments.cn: 我爸爸答应带蛋奶酒，所以我们应该准备好了。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at a couple of phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利度提升中的几个短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
OK, so this first phrase is a phrase that I often heard as a child because I never wanted to go to sleep.
segments.cn: 好的，这第一个短语是我小时候常听到的，因为我从来不想去睡觉。

segments.en: So I'd go downstairs and my parents would say, Catherine, go back to bed.
segments.cn: 所以我会下楼，我的父母会说，凯瑟琳，回去睡觉。

segments.en: Go back to bed.
OK, go back to bed.
So this is just a very common, colloquial, spoken way of saying go back to sleep.
segments.cn: 这只是一个非常常见的口语表达，意思是回去睡觉。

segments.en: Go to sleep.
Don't be awake.
So you can say go to sleep or you can say go to bed.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说去睡觉，或者你可以说回去睡觉。

segments.en: Or if somebody has gotten out of bed, you say go back to bed.
segments.cn: 或者如果有人已经起床，你可以说回去睡觉。

segments.en: Exactly.
And so parents often use this with their kids because they want their kids to sleep.
segments.cn: 所以父母常常对他们的孩子使用这个，因为他们希望孩子们能睡觉。

segments.en: You can also say it about someone who's, you know, up at night worrying and you say, come on, go back to bed, go to sleep, relax.
segments.cn: 你也可以对那些晚上担心的人说，快点，回去睡觉，去睡觉，放松一下。

segments.en: OK.
And then we also saw this phrase, knock yourself out.
segments.cn: 然后我们还看到这个短语，尽情享受。

segments.en: All right, Timmy, knock yourself out.
So what is this?
Knock yourself out.
Well, I'm not really sure where this phrase comes from.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不太确定这个短语的来源。

segments.en: I mean, to knock is like to knock on a door, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，敲是像敲门，对吧？

segments.en: But to knock yourself out, if I think about it, it probably means that you hit yourself in the head and you fall over.
segments.cn: 但“敲自己出去”，如果我想想，可能意味着你打了自己的头，然后摔倒。

segments.en: But the real meaning of this is go have fun.
segments.cn: 但这个短语的真正含义是去玩得开心。

segments.en: OK, have as much fun as you can have.
segments.cn: 好的，尽可能地玩得开心。

segments.en: Right.
Have as much fun as you want.
Go knock yourself out.
So the parent is saying, hey, Timmy, go have as much fun as you want.
segments.cn: 所以父母在说，嘿，蒂米，去尽情享受吧。

segments.en: Just go do it.
Enjoy yourself.
Yeah, like go open all these presents.
segments.cn: 是的，去打开所有这些礼物。

segments.en: Have all the fun you want.
All right.
And then we saw another phrase when they finished talking about dinner and all the things they have to buy.
segments.cn: 然后我们看到另一个短语，当他们谈完晚餐和所有需要购买的东西时。

segments.en: They said we should be set.
segments.cn: 他们说我们应该准备好了。

segments.en: We should be set or we are set.
segments.cn: 我们应该准备好或我们准备好了。

segments.en: Well, this is funny because she says, well, my dad's going to bring the eggnog, so we should be set, which means we should have everything we need.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为她说，我爸爸会带蛋奶酒，所以我们应该准备好了，这意味着我们应该有我们需要的一切。

segments.en: So we don't need anything else.
segments.cn: 所以我们不需要其他东西。

segments.en: We're ready.
Everything is good.
Exactly.
So we can say we are set.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说我们准备好了。

segments.en: I'm set.
Are you set?
It's a way to say, are you ready?
segments.cn: 这是一种问你准备好了吗？

segments.en: Are you prepared?
Do you have everything you need?
So I often use this when I'm going on a trip.
segments.cn: 所以我经常在旅行时使用这个。

segments.en: Right.
Are you set?
Did you pack everything?
segments.cn: 你把所有东西都打包好了吗？

segments.en: Are you all set?
Are you all set?
Yeah.
All right.
I finished packing.
I'm all set.
I'm ready to go.
All set and ready to go.
segments.cn: 一切准备就绪，随时出发。

segments.en: All right.
OK, so some interesting phrases there as well.
segments.cn: 好的，这里还有一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we have a look at our dialogue for the last time?
segments.cn: 我们最后再看看我们的对话吧？

segments.en: Dad, dad, dad, wake up.
It's Christmas.
Timmy, it's too early for this.
Look, it's six in the morning.
Go back to bed.
No way.
Santa already came and left all our presents.
segments.cn: 圣诞老人已经来了，留下了我们的所有礼物。

segments.en: Can we go open them, please?
segments.cn: 我们可以去打开它们吗？

segments.en: Please?
Of course we can, honey.
Bill, come on, get dressed.
Fine.
Not like Santa brought me any gifts.
segments.cn: 反正圣诞老人也没给我带礼物。

segments.en: Bill, honestly, you can be such a grouch sometimes.
segments.cn: 比尔，老实说，你有时候真是个脾气不好的人。

segments.en: Look at all these presents under the Christmas tree.
segments.cn: 看看圣诞树下的这些礼物。

segments.en: Awesome.
All right, Timmy, knock yourself out.
We should get ready and head to the market to buy everything for Christmas dinner tonight.
segments.cn: 我们应该准备一下，去市场买今晚圣诞晚餐的一切。

segments.en: Yeah, you're right.
It's the first time we're hosting Christmas dinner at our house.
segments.cn: 这是我们第一次在家里举办圣诞晚餐。

segments.en: So everything has to be perfect.
I got the list right here.
Ham, Turkey, mashed potatoes, ingredients for the gravy and, of course, yams.
segments.cn: 火腿，火鸡，土豆泥，肉汁的配料，当然还有红薯。

segments.en: My dad offered to bring the eggnog, so we should be set.
segments.cn: 我爸爸提议带蛋奶酒，所以我们应该没问题。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
So as you mentioned, Christmas morning is great.
segments.cn: 正如你提到的，圣诞早晨很棒。

segments.en: You open presents and, well, breakfast.
And it's a time to be together with your parents, your family.
segments.cn: 这是和父母、家人一起的时光。

segments.en: But as in this case, you can be a little bit of a grouch because you're just kind of tired because you had Thanksgiving in November and then Christmas and now you're having New Year's.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，你可能会有点脾气，因为你只是有点累，因为你在十一月过了感恩节，然后是圣诞节，现在又要过新年。

segments.en: So you're kind of just like, yeah, the holiday season can be exhausting.
segments.cn: 所以你有点像，是的，假期季节可能会很累。

segments.en: And I know a lot of families have a special dinner on the 24th, that's Christmas Eve.
segments.cn: 我知道很多家庭在24号有特别的晚餐，那是平安夜。

segments.en: And then by the time it's Christmas Day, the 25th, you're exhausted.
segments.cn: 然后等到圣诞节的25号，你就累坏了。

segments.en: You didn't get any sleep.
You might have had too much to drink last night.
segments.cn: 你昨晚可能喝得太多了。

segments.en: And so it can be very tiring also because the kids always get up way too early, like six o'clock.
segments.cn: 所以这也可能很累，因为孩子们总是起得太早，比如六点。

segments.en: Right.
To open their presents.
And then they'll be playing with their toys all day and you'll be you'll have a headache.
segments.cn: 然后他们会整天玩玩具，而你会头疼。

segments.en: But it's a great season to spend time with the family.
segments.cn: 但这是一个与家人共度时光的好季节。

segments.en: And well, we want to know how you spend your Christmas Eve and your Christmas morning.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你是如何度过你的平安夜和圣诞早晨的。

segments.en: So why don't you come to our website, EnglishPod.com and leave your questions and comments there as well.
segments.cn: 所以你为什么不来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，留下你的问题和评论呢？

segments.en: We're looking forward to hearing from you again.
segments.cn: 我们期待再次听到你的消息。

segments.en: Happy holiday season.
And until next time, bye bye.
